website_summaries.verdict: This durable scrubber works well for homes, workshops, and RVs, but may be too narrow for an actual job site with wide work boots.
pros: All-in-one scrubber, scraper, and cleaner for boots and shoes
Durable heavy gauge welded metal frame
High density composite plastic edges will not rot or crack from snow, rain, barnyard acids, or weather
Stiff bristles clean bottoms and sides of boots
cons: Too narrow for many work boots
Must be bolted down to work effectively, so consider using a board if your floor space doesn't work

customer_reviews.title: Needs a protected location
customer_reviews.text: We attached the Boot Scrubber to a deck on the west side of our second home in Maine less than a year ago. I rarely used it because it was pretty difficult to drag my boots through the brushes. It’s a tight fit for even a women’s work boot. In any case, I did try to use it recently and the brushes fell apart. I’m guessing either the afternoon sun or the winter snow or some combination of the two was just too much for it. Might do better in a protected location. Just didn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.author: LJT

customer_reviews.title: sturdy made, but a narrow foot bed and very weak screws
customer_reviews.text: Pros: a sturdy frame with very stiff bristles, held in place by hard plastic. I bought this to replace another boot scrubber that had the bristles in wood that eventually rotted. Cons: the opening is very narrow. My boot presses the side bristles down instead of remaining horizontal and cleaning the side of boots. The screws provided are weak A.F. All four stripped before I was able to screw them fully into my deck. And, yes, I drilled pilot holes in my deck, so I wasn't over-torquing the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Good boot scraper
customer_reviews.text: A bit tight for 12W boots, but the side bristles get into the sole lugs just fine if you go at an angle, and this model has flats and corners on the metal sides to scrape soles (not round like some). Plastic blocks, weatherproof. Seems very sturdy. Mounted it on a piece of plywood to stand back and get good leverage. Aim it into the bushes, not at your house, for the spatter.
customer_reviews.author: M. Luce

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but missing attaching screws.
customer_reviews.text: The actual product is ok, as described. However the box that it was packaged in from the manufacture looked like it had been thrown off a two story building. Also, the mounting screws that were supposed to come with the product were completely missing, which means I had to make a trip to the Hardware store. While not a complete failure, this tells me the manufacture (in china, of course) has little if any pride it its product and could care less if you got what you paid for or not. For a cheap product, i guess one should not complain much or have any real expectations of quality. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan81

customer_reviews.title: This will remove ALL the mud!
customer_reviews.text: This foot brush is awesome - thick, and heavy, and tight enough to get all the dirt, mud, etc off of your boots. You do have to mount it to something sturdy so it won't move. I ended up mounting it to a 2x12 board that is long enough that I could stand on the board with one foot, and push the other through the brushes. If you have large feet, it may be too tight, but works great on my size 8s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: This is well built, and I expect it will hold up well in the weather. I made a mistake in locating it. I mounted it facing a wall, and about 1 foot from that wall. The long bristles flick large amounts of mud when you draw your boot back. So it sprays mud all over my wall. That's not a defect in the product. Just consider that when you locate it.
customer_reviews.author: GScott

customer_reviews.title: Must be screwed down to work
customer_reviews.text: First of all, unless you are okay with screwing this to your deck or a board, it will not work. Secondly, it only works one way with the brushes. Most boots now have oddly shaped soles and moving the brush in only one direction will not reach all the crevices. Thirdly, first time using a few of the plastic brushes bent. Not happy. I have ordered two different boot scrubbers now that will alleviate all of these drawbacks.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Travis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy boot cleaner. Nice stiff bristles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my camper. I was dragging in mud, dirt, twigs constantly, even tho it hadn't rained. I dont have boots that have waffle treads either. I screwed this on a log next to steps. Now my camper is clean. The bristles are really sturdy to get the job done. Cut down on all the debris in the camper.
customer_reviews.author: Tansyn

customer_reviews.title: Minor mod and bolted to work trailer
customer_reviews.text: A coworker put one on the back of his work trailer. I saw it was a great idea so i did the same, works great! Just enlarged two of the holes on the boot scrubber and used some nuts, bolts and washers from our shelves
customer_reviews.author: Rex Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Winters in Oregon mean MUD. This does the trick at the end of the day after working in the yard. I had my son mount it on a piece of 2 x 12 so it could be moved. Also, when we use the scraper we let the hose trickle on it. This helps remove the rocks and mud from the treads on the bottom of our boots. I like that this removes mud from all around the boot bottoms. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LauraD

customer_reviews.title: Work great and last
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now and love them both. I need to clean my shoes after doing chores and before going in the house and these work well. I would recommend mounting them on a short, open bottom stand so that the dirt doesn’t accumulate on a solid surface. My friends all want one, even though they live in town and don’t have the muck that I deal with on the farm. Don’t expect dress shoes to get through unscathed. These are for work boots and they are very durable bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Ann A.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute beast
customer_reviews.text: An absolute beast. Pros - takes care of mud and animal waste (we raise livestock) - bolting into deck means the mess stays in one place Cons - bolting into deck makes it harder to clean up dirt and mud afterwards (Minor issue)
customer_reviews.author: Todd Brogowski

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: It’s a tight fit for my size 9 boot: which is great. Need to bolt it down to a board in such a way that you can stand on the board with one boot while running your other boot through the scrubber. I live in northeast Florida with lots of sand. The scrubber takes the sand off and keeps me from tracking it into the house and making the spouse mad😊
customer_reviews.author: Hannadog

customer_reviews.title: Tough and Effective!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Kentucky where humidity and high dew points are the norm in the summer. We are cutting the grass every 4 days this time of year. Walking to the barn and back in the morning tracks clippings into the house, of it did until we got the Jobsite. I have mounted it on a 24” square sheet of plywood that I painted. It’s a simple matter of hiding it off to get ride if built up debris. Very satisfied with the durability and performance with my work boots or muck boots.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Maldaner III

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but...
customer_reviews.text: Well built and for $20 on Amazon it’s a good deal, but...If you’re a normal sized person (6’3”, shoe/boot size 13 or 14) you’re only going to get one side of your foot gear in this scrubber. Probably have to trim the bristles back at least an inch or more. Bet it’s made in China where they think a size 8 is giant!
customer_reviews.author: Scupper

customer_reviews.title: I love the overall product
customer_reviews.text: I love the overall product. The bristles are strong enough to remove even dried stuck on debris from shoes. My only complaint with this product is is not made wide enough for boots or anyone with a wide shoe. It does work well for people with smaller feet. The feature of being able to screw it down to my porch is great as it gives me the ability to use it without having to worry about it moving. It is easy to hose off after each use and so far has been a handy product that is well made.
customer_reviews.author: ormedic

customer_reviews.title: A bit tight!
customer_reviews.text: The bristles are strong and remove most debris from shoe bottoms but the unit itself is somewhat small and my boots and hikers barely squeeze into it. Maybe cause it’s new.....I hope... My husband will be the real test. We use for our chicken coop and dog bombs and use it daily!
customer_reviews.author: cindy vacante

customer_reviews.title: Tight fight but works well.
customer_reviews.text: Good price for boot scraper. I like the composite material but only time will tell how long it will last. The bristles are a bit stiff, some sort of coarse plastic, makes for a tight fit, but also for a clean boot. My porch is concrete so I attached it to a piece of wood I had lying around. It gives you a platform to stand on & collects most of the dirt for easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Cairmot

customer_reviews.title: Keeps its bristles and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This is the scrubber that works on a farm. Our boots are always covered in mud, sand, sticks and other debris, and since we bought this scrubber, our porch looks like it got a facelift. After a few months of use, the item still looks like new. All the bristles are still there, they bend and brush as well as they did the first day we used it. I only wish I had bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Freddi78

customer_reviews.title: So small it's useless
customer_reviews.text: When I got this I opened the box and was impressed. Then I noticed the base was warped. Not a problem I was going to mount it. Once mounted I actually attempted to use it. I have a size ten shoe/boot and could not get a shoe in because of the narrowness and the stiffness of the brush bristles. Since I threw the packing away I can't return it so the next trip will be to the dump.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Little narrow
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old cheap boot scrubber was falling apart. The wood was cracking and bristles were everywhere. I ordered this as a replacement. Its better made than my older one but is a little narrow even for my D width foot. Works well and the screws that came with it drove right into the piece of pressure treated 2x10 I used to mount it on. All in all very satisfied but took 1 star off due to the narrowness. Ill probably purchase another one for outside the back door.
customer_reviews.author: William J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Happy we got this one for it's obvious durability.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. It is now attached to our deck, next to the step. The bristles are good and stiff (necessary in the woods here) and gets the crud out of our work boots pretty darn well. It's well built, the metal sarapers on both sides are really helpful for those shoes without treaded soles. I'm happy we got this one for it's obvious durability.
customer_reviews.author: In the HillsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered the "extra wide" 4.5 inch wide version. This one brushes the uppers of my shoes a little too much, so I gave it a haircut. I need to clean the soles. One of the bottom brushes was not installed properly. The screws were loose and it was off center. When I took it off to fix it, I found an almost dead stinkbug in the space inside.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: **Update to 5 stars. Easy to clean if you mount it to a scrap piece of wood!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted it on a 2x6x30 pressure treated piece of scrap. Seems to be good and even the kids use it. Stand on the wood and clean one boot/shoe and then turn around and do the other. Worked great this snow/mud season so far. Easy to clean since I can turn it over and dump out the detritus. (guess I got something out of science class!) **Update-going great through two snowy\muddy winters headed into third. Still solid and working well.
customer_reviews.author: TBigATC

customer_reviews.title: I asked a woman in tennis shoes to try it and that was marginal at best.
customer_reviews.text: I expected to be able to put my boot in it without trouble, but that was not the case. I asked a woman in tennis shoes to try it and that was marginal at best. I would also like to see the makers of boot scrubbers agree on a uniform pattern to attach them. I've replace three and the drill patterns were different on all. I do like that the sides were made of plastic instead of wood, which easily breaks.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: No Wood on Boot Scraper
customer_reviews.text: This is second one of the Boot Scrubber that we have purchased; love the fact that there is no wood involved, so no wood rot; I am hoping that when the time comes, we can replace the brushes; will need to contact supplier to see if they are available. So far, it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Randy & Edna Frost

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have a place to mount it
customer_reviews.text: It is a quality scrubber, but it has to be mounted to something so it does not move as you use it. If you have a place to do that, then great. It should work well. Unfortunately I do not have a place to mount it as driveway to front porch is all concrete. I have another scrubber that you can step on it with another foot to prevent slipping and that is what I am going to stick with.
customer_reviews.author: aJayM

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The inside door mat stays a lot cleaner now. We attached the boot scrubber to a plywood board sized so we can put one foot on the board to hold the brush in place while brushing the other shoe. Seems well made, we will see how long it keeps cleaning our shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CeleB

customer_reviews.title: The brushes are stiff to do the job. Brushes are not mounted on wood. Can withstand weather.
customer_reviews.text: I mount it on 2 pieces of 2 foot long painted wood. Place it next to the railing to keep my balance. Allow gap between the wood for the dirt to drop in between. Works very well. Keep dirt and grass out of the house. Since the unit is not made of wood, I can leave it in the open even when it rains. Good sturdy unit and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Creek

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The only negative it's bit narrow our work boots- For normal shoes and dressier boots it's fine. It's very hardy- I believe it will last for a long time. Bristles stay stiff and hold shape. Note: Be prepared to attach it to floor or something that will keep it from sliding while using it. Arrived promptly and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha Raisins

customer_reviews.title: can't get my foot in it.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be water resistant, sturdy, strong bristles & easy to clean. I have small feet (size 8 shoes) & an unable to force my shoe into the scraper. I can scrape one side at a time though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very durable...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned multiple boot scrubbers and they couldn’t take the wear and tear. This is very durable! I secured mine to a piece of piece plywood so I can step on the board with one foot and use the scrubber with the other. I can take it to multiple jobsites and just wash the mud off and it’s ready to go again. Very happy with my purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Chile'

customer_reviews.title: Good Work Boot brush.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good heavy duty scrubber. As other reviews have mentioned, you might not want to use it on your soft leather shoes, but with a name like Jobsite, this isn't something I'd buy to clean my Johnston & Murphy's. Works just fine on my Danner's though. I have one by the back door, and one by the side/garage door. Dirt will collect at the bottom, but thanks to the open sides, it will hose off just fine. If you do want something for softer more sensitive shoes, look for a brush with a smaller diameter bristle.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harty

customer_reviews.title: Hoping it last longer than similar ones made with wood.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of the wooden ones almost identical to this product with disappointing results. The wooden ones would split and break off, rendering the product useless after limited usage. Hoping the man made products holding the bristles on this boot scrubber are more durable and last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Tee Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great product - poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: Product itself arrived intact and works as advertised, but the box was pretty beat up and there was a little baggie attached for mounting screws, but the bag had a hole in it and there were no screws. Fortunately I have some spare screws so it didn't affect me too much.
customer_reviews.author: F. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Handy on the farm
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I’ve purchased. The first is still at the in-laws and works great other than one of the bottom scrubbers recently having fallen off. To prevent this on the new one, I took it apart and put epoxy on all the contact areas between the metal and plastic that holds the bristles.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb H.

customer_reviews.title: Too Small for Size 13 boots
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product if you have relatively small boots. I could not get my boots through. The width should be adjustable or come in two sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Tree Farmer Russ

customer_reviews.title: Darn durable.
customer_reviews.text: Hah! "How long can you wear them comfortably?" I'm going to say that wearing this will leave a mark that won't be better in the morning...... On the other hand, using for the purpose intended? Pretty much wears like iron, a lot longer than the jute-woven-in-metal ones we replaced yearly. Still in good shape. Note that the best use is to screw it down on a board you can stand on with one foot while scrubbing the other; the brushes are tight on your boot.
customer_reviews.author: Janice K.

customer_reviews.title: Opening for shoes is too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: The opening for a shoe is too narrow. My husband's size 10 street shoes will not fit. The scrubber as it is DOES NOT WORK. Instead of returning the product we will try to trim the brushes to allow normal adult shoes to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Margo A

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be mounted. Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first boot scrubbing thing I have ever bought. My wife is in love with it because my boots don't track in nearly as much dirt as before. So mission accomplished, it works. This needs to be mounted on something though. Here's what I did. It wobbly, but it works. The brush itself seems small but it encompasses the sides of the boot to my ankle. Just shove it in and work it
customer_reviews.author: Harley Fioretti

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, sturdy unit but too narrow for my shoes / boots (size 11 men). The spacing of the side brushes make it difficult to move your foot back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Does' Leap

customer_reviews.title: Clean well
customer_reviews.text: Does not stay down when cleaning my boots, but my husband attached them to a board for added weight. We place it outside our camper and clean our boots when return from hiking and love the way the brushes clean sides and bottom really well.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Menard

customer_reviews.title: Boot Scraper
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Gets the job done. Definitely needs to be bolted to a board, etc. The scraper has to be locked in place in order to work. It is not massive enough by itself to stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget-Guy

customer_reviews.title: A great shoe scraper!
customer_reviews.text: This boot scraper does a great job getting the mud off of my shoes. Now, I just need to clean it out.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dayton

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Love this little life saver. I live on a ranch and am constantly dealing with dirt/mud on my boots. Since buying this boot scrubber, the dirt tracked inside the house is practically gone!
customer_reviews.author: Country Girl

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile investment!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the job, as at this point when it rains on the construction site it is a mud hole. It cleans the boots well, weather going into the office or truck. A worth while investment.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL T. CURTIS

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy but I bought it for my boyfriend since he works on construction sites and brings home dirt everyday. I can totally recommend this to anyone that has a boyfriend/husband that works in a dirt area
customer_reviews.author: Keaonna

customer_reviews.title: Made my wife happy!
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of cleaning my shoes after I've been working in the yard. I mounted to a piece of Plywood and put it by the garage door into the house. Voila! No more complaints about dirty shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BIgBad

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Only had a chance to use it a couple of time, but it did the job. I mounted it to a 1"X8" instead of permanently so I can throw it in the garage when not in use. Would have given 5 starts but it arrived warped and I had to straighten back into a rectangular shape.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Excelent Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this five stars if I felt that everyone buying it had small feet like myself. I wear a size 7.5 D mans shoe. I think the side brushes are a bit too close for large shoes. The build quality is excellent. I've had a few others that did not hold up. I permanently mounted it to the concrete on my back porch and would recommend doing the same.
customer_reviews.author: RichardTerrio

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Well I can happily say that after almost a year of constant and heavy use (think construction site) this boot scrubber still hasn't let us down. It's taken a beating and it's still performing well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stancic

customer_reviews.title: Mounting suggestion
customer_reviews.text: Mounted two strong magnets in a forstner bit hole underneath the and screwed 2 washers with concrete screws in the deck to hold the unit onto the patio. This way, the unit can be pulled off to clean or replace when it wears out
customer_reviews.author: Jolly Roger in MA

customer_reviews.title: Works well in the Midwest winter!
customer_reviews.text: We installed this just outside our patio door on the wooden deck. It’s great to help eliminate mud/snow off shoes before entering. I’d recommend for anyone trying to keep a clean house!
customer_reviews.author: Chris B

customer_reviews.title: boot scraper from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This Boot Scraper is very sturdy and well built. I use it everyday. I don't necessarily wear boots but I wanted something strong that would last a long time. I know this will. I nailed it to a 2x4 and it works very well. I take my little dog outside on a leash through out the day and In the winter there are leaves all over the yard and they always stick to my shoes then I track them into the house constantly. I got so tired of picking them up off the carpet so this works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Allie B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Most Effective Cleaner For Outdoor Dirt
customer_reviews.text: If you mount this boot cleaner in the center of a 24inch long 2x8 or 2x10 board it is more effective at cleaning off dirt and mud than any other I've tried and I've tired several boot cleaners.
customer_reviews.author: Dws

customer_reviews.title: This thing is sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised how heavy this was. I am going to mount on a board and carry it to job sites with me so I can clean my boots before jumping into the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Tedward

customer_reviews.title: 0% effective
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit my wife's size 7 boots let alone my work boots.
customer_reviews.author: Names

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: We live in the desert where our shoes are always tracking in stones and thorns. This is just terrific as we have tile floors and sometimes being shoeless feels good , but is painful and this product alleviates the problem. It works so well we ordered another one for our side door.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Dayton

customer_reviews.title: Better Than the Wooden ones!
customer_reviews.text: They are totally on point in there description page. The wooden copies of these split and fall apart. Only lasted me 2 years here in central Florida. You should get this one! It will last you so much longer!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C. Caccamis

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much, I bought another one for home.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and mounted it on a 2 x 10" pressure treated board to have in my motorcoach, which is sometimes parked in a state park or "boondocking" area with grass and dirt. We set it beside the motorhome to clean footwear before entering the coach. This scrubber appears sturdily built, and nicely cleans my "waterproof" rubber shoes that I wear in wet weather when working outside (thus the reason for the one at the house). I will know in a couple of years how well this one holds up. Its is more expensive than a less expensive "copy" available here but I think this one will hold together better.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J

customer_reviews.title: Little small, but otherwise, what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty narrow, but you can force your foot through. Otherwise, it works as expected. I do wish it had a better scraper on it, so I didn't have to rely on the brushes to get the major 'gunk' off. Its difficult to force men's large 'muck boots' through it. My regular workboots are also a chore to clean. But better than tracking it in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you wear a wide boot. MUST MOUNT
customer_reviews.text: Does it's job but.... 1 its completely useless with being mounted to something. A board at least. 2 it's a really tight squeeze. Don't even bother if you wear a wide. I wear a 9.5 and it takes work to squeeze my boot in. It is strudy and strong. It doesnt come off as cheap. After a couple of weeks it did get a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Marc T

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly Disintegrated in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this boot scrubber less than 2 years ago. As of this Spring, the wood that comprises the bottom two brushes has completely rotted away. The bottom brushes have literally disintegrated. Until it disintegrated to the point it can't be used as intended, I treated it gently while cleaning my moderately dirty footwear. The only excuse I can give it is that it is situated in an area that gets full sun (by my front door). That said, I would never buy this particular model again (at any price) as it was not durable enough.
customer_reviews.author: David G Brown

customer_reviews.title: I don't know yet
customer_reviews.text: WE just received this item. Already my husband took the side brush off so it doesn't ruin the leather on his golf shoes which are size 15. I hope it works
customer_reviews.author: pearl

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Like the concept. But you have to mount it to something and not as big as I thought it would be where you put your foot. i put my sneakers through it and it was tight I don't know how it would be with a big work boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for that hard worker in your life
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for men or women. I got one for my dad whose a Mechanic and one for my boyfriend whose a Plumber, both come home with dirty work boots and this is a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Just screw it to a board and It works good
customer_reviews.author: HILLBILLY PA

customer_reviews.title: Clean boots!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, only thing I wuld like better is if the bristles for the bottom of your shoe/boot were a little stiffer. The scrubber get the loose stuff great, but the packed or dried mud id still a little tough to get off. overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kale Salmans

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and mounted it to my porch floor with the included screws. Looks well made. I've used it a couple times and I believe it will do the job quite well.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Boot brush/ scrubber built to last!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several boot scrubbers over the years and this one is the best constructed one I've come across. Hopefully it will be the last one I need.
customer_reviews.author: Allegra Knight

customer_reviews.title: Scraper is great, screws not so much
customer_reviews.text: The scraper is great but the screws supplied by the manufacturer are soft and strip entirely too easy. Do yourself a favor and get four screws from the hardware store and toss the screws that come with the scraper.
customer_reviews.author: ⚜️MS⚜️

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but a bit tight for big, wide shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These tools need to be tied down some way because it takes quite a force to scrape my size 12 walking shoes (popular brands of running and trail shoes) through the channel. I mounted it on a 2x8 that sticks out about 8 inches on each side. By stepping on the 2x8 with the foot not being cleaned the whole thing stays put. We're not really scraping mud but instead myriad hemlock needles that we pick up walking down the driveway. I get the cleaning I want by putting my shoes on the front brush and not scraping it through the full groove. It works great for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Coasting

customer_reviews.title: boot scrubber
customer_reviews.text: AA little hard to drag your shoes through and there is no way to hold it down unless you screw it to the floor. We use it in our rv and put a board under it to stand on while dragging shoe through brushes,,works great
customer_reviews.author: Garland R. Wall Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: These work extremely well in our Georgia red mud. These are very well built and don't look ugly on our deck or outside back door. Excellent overall.
customer_reviews.author: John Rowe

customer_reviews.title: I liked my choice
customer_reviews.text: After looking and reading all the reviews and such on all these scrapers.. i chose this one, and it works great!! we bolted it onto a wood board.. it is perfect..
customer_reviews.author: Meg Swicegood

customer_reviews.title: Walk the dog
customer_reviews.text: We now have an easy way to clean our shoes of grass after walking the dogs early mornings. we mounted it on the deck near the door. Thinking of buying more for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: jennie c.

customer_reviews.title: No wood but epoxy for longevity
customer_reviews.text: The competition is wood and disenigratedafte a month. I like the lip on the sides to scrape your boots/shoes before using the scrubber brushes
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Apgar

customer_reviews.title: Tough stuff
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy; should hold up well overtime, whereas wood will eventually fall apart. Strong bristles to clean messy shoes, boots, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jillybean

customer_reviews.title: Good for boots.
customer_reviews.text: The boot cleaning function seems to work well, I've only used it once so far and could get the full benefit as it really needs to be mounted securely as the brushes fit so tight on the boot that it won't stay in-place otherwise. It also arrived on time and as represented.
customer_reviews.author: John Quisenberry

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. I recommend putting this near a wall so that you can steady yourself. I thought it was a bit narrow at first, but if you pull your foot backwards through it, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: big cheese

customer_reviews.title: Your boots may be made for walkin', but they'll be better if they're clean!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two and mounted them to 16" X 16" concrete pavers with a couple of Tapcon screws so I have stable mounts that are also portable if need be. These units show the luv to your shoes and boots helping keep the krud on the exterior as opposed to the interior.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boot scrubber, but narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Although this scrubber is a tight squeeze for both my husband (size 11E) & myself (size 9.5) boots or tennis shoes, it works well & saves me alot of clean up..This was the first boot scrubber I had bought & I understand they have to be snug to clean, I believe I'll look for one a little wider the next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use it for rock stuck in the soles.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to remove the rocks stuck in the lugs of my shoes. It works on the ones sticking out, but not the ones more inside.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA PARKS

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Work great. Very sturdy bristles. I drag my cat through it It needs to go on wood unless you can screw into a concrete porch
customer_reviews.author: JE-Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: Well Made but Too Stiff and Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the weight and materials of this boot scrubber, preferring the plastic inserts rather than wood, which eventually rots and cracks. The bristles, however, are much stiffer than expected and the space between is too narrow for large men's boots, which have to be forced in (it has to be screwed down). But it certainly does a good job of scrubbing off muck and mud.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Riversong

customer_reviews.title: Clean boot happy wife
customer_reviews.text: We moved to Colorado... the mud sticks to our shoes. My floors really stay so much cleaner since I ordered this boot cleaner!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Different

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: Can't speak to the longevity of this product since I've only had it for a week but it's very sturdy and everyone who has used it has no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Good foot scraper
customer_reviews.text: A little tight with my big shoes but still very much like the way it is designed. I mounted it on a BIG steel scraper 2.5 ft by 2.5 ft right in the middle. Don't have much of a mud problem but rather real sandy around house. Excellent price - other vendors were selling this product for twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: jthomp2

customer_reviews.title: Well made and designed, sturdy, fits on end of step
customer_reviews.text: Well made and designed, sturdy, fits on end of step for convenient and space saving access. L.p.
customer_reviews.author: VickyP

customer_reviews.title: Give Me the Brush Off
customer_reviews.text: This is a much more substantial boot cleaner than a wooden one we had similar to it. The brushes are stiffer and the construction of the body is much more solid.
customer_reviews.author: Sooner

customer_reviews.title: Works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Works for me because I wear men's 10D shoes. This seems to be a well built product, the installation went very well, and the first couple test drives seemed good. I would not recommend this product for anyone with a shoe size larger than mine.
customer_reviews.author: W.Clark

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift, and was very pleased when it was delivered. It's very heavy duty, and definitely appears that it will hold up for a long time. I hope my brother-in-law will be just as happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds mud
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this for my hunting property where it gets really muddy and thought this would be a great product to help keep my camper clean. After the first use of this i noticed that the mud clogged up and was very unusable after that. i would have to spray it with water everytime i used it. that is why i gave a 4 star instead of a five
customer_reviews.author: user19285

customer_reviews.title: Does a pretty good job
customer_reviews.text: We secured this to the wood decking we built outside our hunting camper so we could, obviously, scrape off the mud from the hunting boots before walking into the camper. It works pretty well. Hunting boots usually have pretty deep crevices in the soles so getting the mud scraped out of those crevices is difficult. This doesn't get it all, but it does a fair job. We used it all last fall and again during turkey season and so far it's holding up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Clean Shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Needs to be screwed down to something. Quality is good. Now if I can just get people to use it!
customer_reviews.author: TD2

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.text: I find that it cleans bottoms and sides of soles of shoes and boots easily and I have it mounted on my back deck near the steps so mother nature can keep it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Dadjim13

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We screwed it onto a board that was wide enough to step on, on each side.
customer_reviews.author: L. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Works.
customer_reviews.text: Good tight fit around all sides of my boots. Takes the dirt/mud/dog's presents off my shoes hefore i get in the house. Nothing hard about mounting this. Just screw it in and you're done.
customer_reviews.author: dirt

customer_reviews.title: way to narrow
customer_reviews.text: built for kids shoes, not adult boots. way to hard to force the boot through the narrow close set side brushes to ever begin to make contact with the brush that cleans the bottom !
customer_reviews.author: chuck mock

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but a tad too small
customer_reviews.text: I mounted mine on a piece of 2 X 8 rather than screwing it to the deck. It works fine and looks as if it will last. I wear an 11EEEE and find the brushes a tad too close together for me. I can get through the brushes,but it takes some effort.
customer_reviews.author: BFF

product_meta.title: JobSite The Original Boot Scrubber - All Weather Industrial Shoe Cleaner & Scraper Brush
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :4.25 x 4.5 x 4.5 inches; 3.65 Pounds
 * Item model number :54098
 * Department :Mens
 * Date First Available :February 20, 2011
 * Manufacturer :Jobsite
 * ASIN :B002GXE8RA

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #15,333 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #9 inShoe Brushes 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.7 out of 5 stars1,533 ratings
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
BUILT TO LAST: Heavy Duty high density composite molded plastic sides & welded metal frame make this scraper able to withstand all weather elements without rotting or cracking
ALL-IN-ONE CLEANER: Super coarse brush scrapes away mud, grass, sawdust, snow and other hard stuck on debris from the soles, tread and edges of your boots or shoes without causing harm
MOUNTABLE: Includes four screws for easy bolt down. Perfect for the home, garage, workshop, office buildings or farm. Measures 9.5 x 6.5 x 4.8 inches
ALL WEATHER: Other brands use wood edges that rot and crack when they get wet or exposed to extreme heat and cold, our heavy duty plastic edges will not
TRUSTED BRAND: We guarantee our product will be the best you have ever owned or we will provide a full refund
